It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, flame-like inflorescences that resemble fire. The plant is adapted to extreme heat and drought, with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tauschia infernicola is considered a vulnerable species.
